. "We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time," said Eric Schmidt , who joined Google as CEO in 2001. By clarifying our individual roles, we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead, and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come. Despite Google's solid results for 2010, Larry Page and Sergey Brin may feel Eric Schmidt isn't adequately addressing the challenges the company faces.
